articles.headline: Betting buzz: Analysis finds dip in amount bet on hoops this season
articles.description: The amount bet on basketball was down in both college and professional basketball this season, for a number of reasons.

images.name: LeBron James [1296x729]
images.caption: The Lakers were the most popular team to bet in the NBA this season.
images.alt: LeBron James #23 of the Los Angeles Lakers looks on during the game against the Minnesota Timberwolves during Round 1 Game 1 of the 2025 NBA Playoffs on April 19, 2025 at Crypto.Com Arena in Los Angeles, California.

images.name: Napheesa Collier of Minnesota Lynx [608x342]
images.caption: New WNBA MVP favorite Napheesa Collier is averaging a league-high 29.5 points per game for the Lynx.

images.name: Kuhio Aloy [1296x729]
images.caption: Kuhio Aloy and the Arkansas Razorbacks enter the NCAA Baseball Tournament as favorites.

images.name: Tyrese Haliburton [1296x729]
images.caption: Tyrese Haliburton made this game-tying shot at the end of regulation to send Game 1 to overtime.

images.name: Sergei Bobrovsky [1296x729]
images.caption: Sergei Bobrovsky and the Florida Panthers are co-favorites to win the Stanley Cup.

images.name: Cowboys-Eagles [1296x729]
images.caption: The opening night NFC East matchup between the Dallas Cowboys and Philadelphia Eagles is the most bet-on game of the 2025 NFL season so far, attracting the most handle at three different sportsbooks.
images.alt: Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley (26) carries the ball against Dallas Cowboys defensive back DaRon Bland (26) in the second half during the game between the Dallas Cowboys and Philadelphia Eagles on December 29, 2024.

images.name: knicks-celtics [1296x729] - Copy
images.credit: Nathaniel S. Butler/NBAE via Getty Images
images.caption: Jalen Brunson and the New York Knicks are the current favorites to win the Eastern Conference.

images.name: Hart [1296x729] - Copy
images.caption: Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown (left side) look on as the Celtics drop Game 2 to the New York Knicks.

images.name: Stephen Curry [1296x729]
images.credit: Photo by David Sherman/NBAE via Getty Images
images.caption: Stephen Curry's hamstring strain has shifted the Warriors' odds ahead of Game 2 against the Timberwolves.

images.name: Mikko Rantanen [1296x729]
images.caption: Mikko Rantanen (R) of the Dallas Stars celebrates his game-tying goal in Game 7.

images.name: Stephen Curry and Steve Kerr of Golden State Warriors [608x342]
images.caption: The Warriors are in unfamiliar territory as underdogs in their series with the Timberwolves.

images.name: Shedeur Sanders [1296x729]
images.caption: Both Shedeur Sanders and the Cleveland Browns have been attracting high betting volume in the past week.

images.name: World Series of Poker [1296x729]
images.caption: Players from five states can compete for a share of World Series of Poker pool prizes.

images.name: Cam Ward [576x324]
images.caption: Nobody thinks that anyone other than Cam Ward will be the first player selected in this year's NFL Draft -- and the odds reflect it.
images.alt: Miami quarterback Cam Ward throws the ball during the school's NFL football pro day on March 24, 2025, in Coral Gables, Fla.

images.name: Travis Hunter [1296x729]
images.caption: Travis Hunter being ranked as the top WR and CB in the 2025 NFL is problematic for betting markets.
images.alt: Colorado wide receiver Travis Hunter (12) runs after catching a pass during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Central Florida, Saturday, Sept. 28, 2024, in Orlando, Fla.

images.name: Cooper Flagg [1296x729]
images.caption: Cooper Flagg and Duke fell to Houston late in Saturday's Final Four game.

images.name: florida men's basketball [1296x729]
images.caption: Florida is one of four No. 1 seeds to advance to the Final Four of the men's NCAA basketball tournament.
images.alt: The Florida Gators celebrate after defeating the Texas Tech Red Raiders 84-79 in the West Regional Elite Eight round of the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament at Chase Center on March 29, 2025 in San Francisco, California.

images.name: duke mens basketball [1296x729]
images.caption: The Duke Blue Devils are a key part of one bettor's massive championship future parlay and have made a great tournament run so far. The only issue? He's a longtime Florida Gators fan.
images.alt: Darren Harris #8 and Tyrese Proctor #5 of the Duke Blue Devils celebrate in the second half against the Baylor Bears in the second round of the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament at Lenovo Center on March 23, 2025 in Raleigh, North Carolina.

images.name: Russell Wilson [1296x729]
images.caption: After a brief stint in the AFC, Russell Wilson is heading back to the NFC after signing with the New York Giants, leading to their win total increasing at the sportsbooks Wednesday morning.

images.name: JWill: The Knicks' loss is biggest choke job in NBA playoff history
images.caption: Jay Williams joins "Get Up" and explains why the Knicks' loss to the Pacers is statistically the biggest choke job in NBA playoff history.

articles.headline: Pacers try to wrap up Eastern Conference finals at home after blowing chance against Knicks on road
articles.description: — The Indiana Pacers wasted one chance to wrap up the Eastern Conference finals.

articles.headline: NBA playoff futures: Pacers still big favorites over Knicks
articles.description: With the conference finals almost wrapped up, here are the updated odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP.

images.name: Tyrese Haliburton [1296x729]
images.credit: Jesse D. GarrabrantNBAE via Getty Images
images.caption: The Pacers, up 3-2 in the series against the Knicks, remain big favorites.
images.alt: Tyrese Haliburton #0 of the Indiana Pacers dribbles the ball during the game against the New York Knicks during Game 5 of the 2025 Eastern Conference Finals  on May 29, 2025 at Madison Square Garden in New York City, New York.

images.name: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander of Oklahoma City Thunder [608x342]
Pascal Siakam [1296x729]
images.caption: Pascal Siakam and the Pacers jumped to +450 to win the NBA title following a huge Game 4 win.
images.alt: Indiana Pacers forward Pascal Siakam (43) celebrates during the second half of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals of the NBA basketball playoffs against the New York Knicks in Indianapolis, Tuesday, May 27, 2025.

images.name: Karl-Anthony Towns of New York Knicks [608x342]
images.caption: Karl-Anthony Towns' big fourth quarter in Game 3 helped the Knicks get back in the series with the Pacers.

images.name: Tyrese Haliburton of Indiana Pacers [608x342]
images.caption: The Pacers now have the second-best odds to win the NBA Finals following Wednesday's epic Game 1 rally.

images.name: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander [1296x729]
images.caption: The Oklahoma City Thunder enter the Conference Finals as the heavy favorite to win the 2025 NBA Finals.

images.name: Anthony Edwards [1296x729]
images.caption: Anthony Edwards now has the second shortest odds to win NBA Finals MVP.
images.alt: Minnesota Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards (5) dribbles the ball past Golden State Warriors guard Buddy Hield (7) in the first half during game five of the second round for the 2025 NBA Playoffs at Target Center.

images.name: Karl-Anthony Towns [1296x729]
images.caption: The Knicks and Thunder are the favorites to make it out of their respective conferences.
images.alt: New York Knicks center Karl-Anthony Towns (32) looks to pass the ball against Oklahoma City Thunder guard Luguentz Dort (5) during the first quarter at Madison Square Garden.

images.name: Jalen Brunson [1296x729]
images.caption: Jalen Brunson and the New York Knicks moved to the second-favorite to win the NBA Championship after their Game 5 victory over the Celtics.

images.name: Tyrese Haliburton of Indiana Pacers [608x342]
images.caption: A late 3-pointer from Tyrese Haliburton on Tuesday gave the Pacers an improbable 2-0 series lead.

images.name: Aaron Gordon [1296x729]
images.caption: Aaron Gordon's game-winning 3-pointer has the odds shifting after the Nuggets took Game 1.
images.alt: Denver Nuggets forward Aaron Gordon (32) shoots a three point basket to win game one of the second round against the Oklahoma City Thunder during the 2025 NBA Playoffs at Paycom Center.

images.name: Tyrese Haliburton [1296x729]
images.credit: Lauren Leigh Bacho/NBAE via Getty Images
images.caption: Tyrese Haliburton and the Pacers picked up a huge Game 1 win on the road against heavily favored Cleveland.
images.alt: Tyrese Haliburton #0 of the Indiana Pacers dribbles the ball during the game against the Cleveland Cavaliers during Round 2 Game 1 of the 2025 NBA Playoffs on May 4, 2025 at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse in Cleveland, Ohio.
